documentation:
The Allegro package offers graphics, sounds and input APIs to create simple
  games.

initializers.name: ğŸ”¢
initializers.documentation:
Creates a color from the given RGBA. *r*, *g*, *b* and *a* must be a value
    from 0 to 255.

enumerationValues.documentation: Mathematics argument out of domain of function.

initializers.name: ğŸ“„
initializers.documentation: Creates a bitmap from the image at the given path.

initializers.name: ğŸ†•
initializers.documentation: Creates a bitmap with the given height and width.

types.name: âš–
types.documentation: âš– provides values to align text

types.name: ğŸ•‰
types.documentation:
ğŸ•‰ represents a font. ğŸ•‰ can be used in conjunction with
  [ğŸ”ğŸ”¡](t5535657300.html#cmğŸ”¡) to draw texts to a drawing target.

initializers.name: ğŸ“„
initializers.documentation:
Loads a TrueType font from the given path using the FreeType library.

    The *size* parameter determines the size the font will be rendered at,
    specified in pixels. The standard font size is measured in units per EM, if
    you instead want to specify the size as the total height of glyphs in
    pixels, pass it as a negative value.

types.name: ğŸ‰
types.documentation: ğŸ‰ represents an event. Youâ€™ll always receive subclasses of this class.

types.name: ğŸ“©
types.documentation: ğŸ“© is an event that occurs when a character was typed on the keyboard.

methods.name: ğŸ“Ÿ
methods.documentation: Returns the keycode associated with this event.

methods.name: ğŸ”£
methods.documentation:
Returns the character that was typed. No value is returned if the pressed
    key does not map to a character, e.g. if an arrow key was pressed.

methods.name: ğŸ”ƒ
methods.documentation: Whether the character was repeated.

types.name: ğŸ“¥
types.documentation: ğŸ“¥ is an event that occurs when a keyboard key was pressed.

methods.name: ğŸ“Ÿ
methods.documentation: Returns the keycode associated with this event.

types.name: ğŸ“¤
types.documentation: ğŸ“¤ is an event that occurs when a keyboard key was released.

methods.name: ğŸ“Ÿ
methods.documentation: Returns the keycode associated with this event.

types.name: ğŸ–±
types.documentation: ğŸ–± is a mouse event. Youâ€™ll always receive subclasses of this class.

methods.name: â©
methods.documentation: Returns the x coordinate.

methods.name: â¬
methods.documentation: Returns the y coordinate.

types.name: â‡
types.documentation: â‡ï¸ is an event that occurs when one or more mouse axis changed.

types.name: ğŸ”›
types.documentation: ğŸ”› is an event that occurs when a mouse button was pressed.

types.name: ğŸ”
types.documentation: ğŸ” is an event that occurs when a mouse button was released.

types.name: ğŸ›
types.documentation: ğŸ› is an event that occurs for each â² tick.

types.name: ğŸ—ƒ
types.documentation:
ğŸ—ƒ represents an event queue. An ğŸ—ƒ instance holds events that have been
  generated by event sources that are registered with the queue. Events are
  stored in the order they are generated. Access is in a strictly FIFO
  (first-in-first-out) order.

methods.name: â³
methods.documentation: Waits for an event and returns it.

methods.name: ğŸ–±
methods.documentation: Registers the mouse as an event source.

methods.name: âŒ¨
methods.documentation: Registers the keyboard as an event source.

methods.name: â²
methods.documentation: Registers a â² instance as an event source.

initializers.name: ğŸ†•
initializers.documentation: Creates a new, empty event queue.

types.name: ğŸ“º
types.documentation:
ğŸ“º represents a display.

  All drawing operations end up being visible on a display which is the same as
  a window in windowed environments. Thus, before anything is displayed, a
  display needs to be created.

methods.name: ğŸ·
methods.documentation: Sets the the title of the window.

initializers.name: ğŸ†•
initializers.documentation: Creates a display with the given width and height.

methods.name: ğŸ¦
methods.documentation:
*Flips* the drawing target display. Copies or updates the front and back
    buffers so that what has been drawn previously on the drawing target display
    becomes visible on screen.

methods.name: ğŸ“
methods.documentation: Sets *bitmap* as the current drawing target.

methods.name: ğŸ
methods.documentation:
Sets the bitmap acting as backbuffer of *display* as the current drawing
    target.

methods.name: ğŸš¿
methods.documentation: Fills the entire drawing target with the given color.

methods.name: ğŸ–Š
methods.documentation: Draws a line between the two points ((*x1*|*y1*) and (*x2*|*y2*)).

methods.name: ğŸ“
methods.documentation:
Draws an outlined triangle between the given three points ((*x1*|*y1*),
    (*x2*|*y2*) and (*x3*|*y3*)).

methods.name: ğŸš©
methods.documentation:
Draws a filled triangle between the given three points ((*x1*|*y1*),
    (*x2*|*y2*) and (*x3*|*y3*)).

methods.name: ğŸ“‹
methods.documentation:
Draws an outlined rectangle between the two points ((*x1*|*y1*) and
    (*x2*|*y2*)) which are the upper left and lower right point of the rectangle
    respectively.

methods.name: ğŸ—„
methods.documentation:
Draws a filled rectangle between the two points ((*x1*|*y1*) and
    (*x2*|*y2*)) which are the upper left and lower right point of the rectangle
    respectively.

methods.name: âš½
methods.documentation:
Draws an outlined circle. The center of the circle is the given point
    ((*x1*|*y1*) and the radius is *r*.

methods.name: ğŸ€
methods.documentation:
Draws a filled circle. The center of the circle is the given point
    (*x1*|*y1*) and the radius is *r*.

methods.name: ğŸ‰
methods.documentation:
Draws an outlined rectangle with rounded corners between the two points
    ((*x1*|*y1*) and (*x2*|*y2*)) which are the upper left and lower right point
    of the rectangle respectively.

methods.name: ğŸˆ
methods.documentation:
Draws a filled rectangle with rounded corners between the two points
    ((*x1*|*y1*) and (*x2*|*y2*)) which are the upper left and lower right point
    of the rectangle respectively.

methods.name: ğŸ“¼
methods.documentation: Draws the given bitmap at the given location.

methods.name: ğŸ’½
methods.documentation:
Draws a scaled and cropped version of the given bitmap at the given
    location.

methods.name: ğŸ”¡
methods.documentation: Draws the given text at the given position in the given font and color.

typeMethods.name: ğŸ™‹
typeMethods.documentation:
You must call this method before using any of the other methods as it
    initializes the system. The callback will be called and passed an instance
    of ğŸ” once the application is ready.
